Professional Certificate Courses (Online)

  • Online certificates can be obtained in a range of specialized areas.
  • Online diplomas are awarded for one to two years of study with LMS.
  • Online associate degrees usually take approximately two years then.
  • Online preparatory year programs are an opportunity for students.

item.title: CSS - The Complete Guide (incl. Flexbox, Grid & Sass)
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Learn CSS for the first time or brush up your CSS skills and dive in even deeper. EVERY web developer has to know CSS.

a:3:{i:0;s:73:"You should know the very basics about HTML and web development in general";i:1;s:64:"NO advanced HTML or web development knowledge is required though";i:2;s:72:"NO CSS knowledge is required at all! You'll learn it all in this course!";}

a:3:{i:0;s:82:"Build beautiful websites which don't just contain great content but also look good";i:1;s:42:"Use basic as well as advanced CSS features";i:2;s:70:"Understand the concepts and theory behind CSS and certain CSS features";}

a:3:{i:0;s:82:"Build beautiful websites which don't just contain great content but also look good";i:1;s:42:"Use basic as well as advanced CSS features";i:2;s:70:"Understand the concepts and theory behind CSS and certain CSS features";}

a:3:{i:0;s:90:"Anyone who wants to learn CSS for the first time or wants to sharpen his or her CSS skills";i:1;s:99:"Anyone who's excited to learn about the latest CSS features like Flexbox, CSS Grid or CSS Variables";i:2;s:45:"Anyone who knows CSS but wants to dive deeper";}

If you have an internet connection, courses on Udemy are available on any device at any time. If you don't have an internet connection, some instructors also let their students download course lectures. That's up to the instructor though, so make sure you get on their good side!"}]

In this lesson we learn how to insert an image into a webpage. If you want to edit or resize an image before placing it on your webpage and you do not have access to Adobe Photoshop I recommend the free image editing software named GIMP.

In this lesson we learn about the "<audio>" element which allows us to include audio clips directly on our pages without relying on third party software (Flash). Download the supplementary material .zip file for a working demo of the audio element.

In this lesson we learn about the "<video>" element which allows us to natively include video clips on our pages. However, we learn that there are several factors which make including video on our pages without the help of third party services quite tricky.

Let's apply what we've learned about CSS so far to make our page easier on the eyes.

If you are looking for a color picker I recommend the free Adobe Kuler website / tool. Not only can you click on a circle in the color wheel to find color codes, but Kuler will also provide additional complimentary colors.

In this lesson we learn how to customize the appearance of HTML forms. The lesson mentions third party CSS libraries you can leverage to tackle cross browser styling issues. Here are some of the most popular options in the webDev community:

Formalize

Normalize

Note that Formalize is strictly focused on forms, while Normalize helps level the playing field for all elements across all browsers (e.g. h1-h6, p, table, etc...).

In the past web designer's were limited to a small handful of fonts, but in today's web we are free to use any font we desire thanks to "@font-face" technology.

My favorite free font resources are Google Fonts and Font Squirrel.

Transform";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-07-31T16:11:08Z";s:11:"description";s:619:"

The "transform" property can be used to manipulate the appearance of elements. In this lesson we learn about rotate, scale, skew, and positioning elements.

For extra credit you can explore the possibilities of 3D transforms. We don't delve into 3D transforms in this lesson because the topic demands its own five hour course but if you are interested in learning about 3D effects in the web browser the brilliant David DeSandro has created a freely-available must-read guide!

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:13:"css-transform";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:1795426;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:16:"18-transform.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-08-28T23:17:03Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:15;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:63;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:1512166;s:5:"title";s:15:"CSS Transitions";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-07-31T16:08:54Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:15:"css-transitions";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:1872816;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:20:"19-transition-v2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-09-16T16:55:53Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:14;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:64;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:1512170;s:5:"title";s:14:"CSS Animations";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-07-31T16:08:58Z";s:11:"description";s:480:"

CSS animations allow us to add movement to any element we choose. In this lesson we learn the essentials of controlling how and when elements move.

If you're looking for inspiration regarding what types of animation / "fade-in" effects you can create or use be sure to visit the brilliant Dan Eden's "Animate.css" demo page.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:14:"css-animations";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:1815650;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:16:"20-animation.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-09-03T02:44:21Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:13;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:65;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:476016;s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-10-15T00:18:05Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:12;s:5:"title";s:48:"Leveraging JavaScript without Writing JavaScript";s:11:"description";N;s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:66;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:1794826;s:5:"title";s:18:"Slideshow (Part 1)";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-10-15T00:01:53Z";s:11:"description";s:1024:"

In this lesson we begin to learn what JavaScript is and what it is typically used for. Even though learning how to write JavaScript code is outside the scope of this course we can still leverage existing JavaScript solutions to add new functionality to our pages.

In particular, this lesson showcases the creation of a slideshow. In the lesson we make use of the excellent "Cycle2" script written by Mike Alsup. You can find the official Cycle2 documentation page here.

Be sure to download the .zip file attached to this lesson to dissect and analyze things for yourself.

Quick note about website speed: in this lesson we include JavaScript files in the <head> section of our HTML. While this location may be simple to remember we can achieve better performance by placing JS directly before our pages closing <body> element.

In particular, this lesson showcases the creation of a slideshow. In the lesson we make use of the excellent "Cycle2" script written by Mike Alsup. You can find the official Cycle2 documentation page here.

Be sure to download the .zip file attached to this lesson to dissect and analyze things for yourself.

In this lesson we learn how to initially hide bits of content and then reveal that content later by clicking / tapping on a trigger element.

Here is a link to the declarativeToggle download & documentation page.

As always, you can download the .zip file associated with this lecture to grab a copy of the finished product.

Quick note about website speed: in this lesson we include JavaScript files in the <head> section of our HTML. While this location may be simple to remember we can achieve better performance by placing JS directly before our pages closing <body> element.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:32:"reveal-hide-content-on-click-tap";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2013032;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"02-toggle.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-10-15T20:52:48Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:9;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:69;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:1836562;s:5:"title";s:36:"Open Image in Modal Window (Gallery)";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-10-24T18:09:19Z";s:11:"description";s:733:"

In this lesson we learn how to open images in a modal window, and also how to align thumbnail images in a strict grid.

Here is a link to the Lightbox package we leverage during the lesson.

As always, you can download the .zip associated with this lecture to grab the finished product.

Quick note about website speed: in this lesson we include JavaScript files in the <head> section of our HTML. While this location may be simple to remember we can achieve better performance by placing JS directly before our pages closing <body> element.

Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets (Sass). In this lesson we learn what Sass is, what problems it solves, and why so many developers have made it an integral part of their workflow. Below are links to free resources mentioned in the lesson.

  • SassMeister
  • CodePen
  • Scout
  • Koala
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:17:"sass-introduction";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:1825846;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:11:"21-sass.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-09-05T03:22:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:6;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:72;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:1509682;s:5:"title";s:14:"Sass Continued";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-07-30T23:34:07Z";s:11:"description";s:705:"

We continue to learn about Sass by reviewing Mixins and operators. Below are links to free resources mentioned in the lesson.

  • Compass
  • Bourbon
  • Susy
  • Official Sass Website
  • The Sass Way
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:14:"sass-continued";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:1840918;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"22-sass-continued.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-09-08T21:16:14Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:5;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:73;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:400320;s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-07-30T23:38:00Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:4;s:5:"title";s:27:"Cross Browser Compatibility";s:11:"description";N;s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:74;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:1509706;s:5:"title";s:17:"Feature Detection";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-07-30T23:39:00Z";s:11:"description";s:383:"

In this lesson we learn how to leverage Can I Use and Modernizr to make sure that we can include modern CSS features such as animations without leaving visitors with older browsers out in the cold.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:17:"feature-detection";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:1845142;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"20-feature-detection.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-09-09T20:47:03Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:3;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:75;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:1646656;s:5:"title";s:24:"Browser & Device Testing";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-09-05T20:12:41Z";s:11:"description";s:386:"

In this lesson we learn about testing your pages in different web browsers and devices. In particular we learn about Google Chrome's emulation tools and also the amazing Modern IE website which offers free screenshot services and a library of free virtual machines for legacy testing.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:22:"browser-device-testing";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:1854092;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:20:"20-cross-testing.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-09-11T20:23:26Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:2;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:76;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:436344;s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-09-05T20:08:16Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:1;s:5:"title";s:18:"Beyond This Course";s:11:"description";N;s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:77;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:1646644;s:5:"title";s:10:"Next Steps";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-09-05T20:08:21Z";s:11:"description";s:1651:"

In this lesson we discuss logical next steps after you have mastered the basics of HTML and CSS.

If you have any questions please feel free to start a course discussion or direct message me.

If you are interested in learning JavaScript I recommend two resources. The first is a YouTube video which explains the practical / traditional uses of JavaScript. The second is a free eBook which has become the industry standard for learning JavaScript, written by Marijn Haverbeke.

Below are links to the popular communities listed in the lesson:

  • WordPress
  • Drupal
  • Ruby on Rails
  • Symfony
  • CodeIgniter

If you are interested in WordPress; I have created a freely available video series on learning WordPress on YouTube.

item.title: Deep Learning A-Z: Hands-On Artificial Neural Networks
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Learn to create Deep Learning Algorithms in Python from two Machine Learning & Data Science experts. Templates included.

Advantages of launching brand through Amazon FBA";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-25T10:36:00Z";s:11:"description";s:559:"

Withamazon fulfillment services you will be able to send your inventory to Amazon FBA centers and let them do all the dirty work such as storing, picking, packing and shipping. You will pay for fulfillment by amazon services once your product is sold.

Amazon fulfillment locations

  • United states
  • United Kingdom
  • EU:U.K., Germany, France, Italy, or Spain
  • Japan
  • Mexico

Selling on amazon FBA can be done even if you don't live in one of these countries.

If you are from Kuwait, Bosnia, South Africa or any other country that is not accepted for seller registration, then Ihave a great and low cost solution for you.

It will require a few additional steps, but it will give you an opportunity to sell on Amazon even if your country is not yet on Amazon's list. Keep in mind that Amazon is constantlyexpandingthat list and adding new countries.

Learnhow to sell on Amazon US andUK marketplaceseven if your country is not on the list of countries accepted for seller registration.

P.S.

It's not Payoneer!

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:66:"how-to-get-back-in-the-game-if-your-previous-account-was-suspended";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4665412;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:65:"Getting back in the game after the previous account suspended.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-11-19T15:09:47Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:151;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:15;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:4259094;s:5:"title";s:70:"Adding additional layer of security when accessing your seller account";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-12-30T10:02:35Z";s:11:"description";s:694:"

You need to be extremely careful from where you access your Amazon seller account. Because from one computer and internet connection you can access only one seller central account.

So one computer and internet connection can not be used for accessing multiple amazon seller accounts. Simply because Amazon forbids you to have multiple seller accounts. So accessing multiple accounts from same computer and internet connection can be a strong sign that you have multiple accounts and it can get your account in trouble.

Learn how to securely manage your Amazon business while you are on the go, from any computer and internet connection (even from hotel and public WiFi).

EINis not mandatory for importing products or selling on Amazon as a foreigner. However if you are using sea or air cargo it will be much simpler and cheaper to import products if you have an EIN number.

Learn how to obtain EINas a foreigner in just a few easy steps.

P.S.

You will need to call the IRS over the phone, so make sure that you have Skype credits because this is not a toll-free number.

Choosing a niche to enter is one of the most crucial decisions you'll make in your Amazon brand launching journey. Simply because in order to make most out of a brand you will probably add new products down the line in the same niche to leverage the audience you have built. Off course if your first product was a success.

Competition is becoming tougher and tougher, and that is way you can not solely rely on product listing optimization. You will have to employ multiple marketing weapons, which include content marketing, social media marketing, video marketing etc.

And in order to know exactly what is the best angle of providing value to your potential customers you will need to pick a niche in which you are truly good at, that you understand, in which you are willing to learn and follow the latest trends.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:59:"brainstorm-product-ideas-using-amazon-best-seller-rank-list";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4835726;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:66:"Brainstorming Product Ideas Using Amazon Best Seller Rank List.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-12-15T13:22:56Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:133;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:33;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2369572;s:5:"title";s:72:"Incremental product improvement system - outsell your direct competitors";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-06T20:58:26Z";s:11:"description";s:748:"

If you sell the exact same product like your top competitor you will have much harder time competing and outranking them. You need to give a great reason why customers should purchase your product instead of an already established one from top competitors.

Selling identical products like everyone else will probably put you out of business in a year or two. Unless you have entered the market at early growth stage or if you have an established audience outside Amazon.

You NEED to differentiate as much as you can!

This exercise will help you find what customers desperately want in your product. And then use those features as main benefit and value proposition of your product.

Learn which tool Iuse to roughly estimate how many sales toexpect for each BSR number.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:51:"tracking-competitors-product-sales-using-999-method";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6139880;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:55:"Tracking competitors product sales using 999 method.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-06-03T18:22:15Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:129;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:37;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5093956;s:5:"title";s:54:"Double checking BSR numbers and seasonality of a niche";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-05-11T22:07:12Z";s:11:"description";s:493:"

Best seller rank shows how a certain product is selling compared to other products in the same category.

The main problem with BSRis that you can not see for which time frame it is. Amazon doesn't give you history of BSR numbers. However, BSRhistory is extremely important to see if a product/niche isseasonal and to see how consistent sales are for a product that you are analyzing.

Learn how and which tool I use to analyze best seller rank history of a product.

Still on the fence? Don't know which product to launch on Amazon?

ThisFRESH & UPDATEDlist of hot products to sell on amazon can help you uncover some of the most lucrative and high demand niches.

---> The list has been updated on September 2016

HURRY! The earlier you join the more opportunities you will receive, because the list is updated monthly, and previous lists are being replaced with new ones!

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:48:"private-label-product-ideas-september-2016-issue";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6931088;s:10:"asset_type";s:7:"Article";s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-10-06T06:12:05Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:124;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:42;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3196402;s:5:"title";s:41:"List of products you can source with 200$";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-07-03T21:49:06Z";s:11:"description";s:1362:"

Use this list if you are not sure if private labeling is the right business model for you or you simply want to balance the risk and try how the whole process of private labeling works with least amount of money.


This list contains products that can be sourced for 200$. I have also included links to suppliers.


NOTE: The purpose of this list is only to show that you dont need thousands of dollars in order to source your own private label product. However, it should NOT distract you from products you found during niche and product research. Some of these products are great opportunities and some arent. Make sure you do the product competition and demand analysis before sourcing one of these products.


This is just the tip of the iceberg...there are much more products that can be sourced with less than 200$. But please consider that I have not included additional costs such as shipping, inspection services, customs fees and taxes, legal protection, product launch and initial advertising costs.


Please, if you are on a really tight budget then consider other Amazon selling strategies. Private labeling is not only about sourcing products, it's about building a brand through external marketing efforts, which requires additional investments.

If you don't follow the exact Amazon FBA labeling requirements, receiving of your inbound shipment might be delayed for several weeks.

According to Amazon: "Failure to comply with these safety requirements and product restrictions may result in refusal or destruction of inventory immediately upon receipt at the Amazon fulfillment center."

In this lecture I will show you step by step what you MUST include on product packaging to avoid newbie mistakes.

Also I reveal what is necessary in order to avoid your products being seized by customs.

However many sellers underestimate the power of well crafted keyword-rich titles.

Also I have included "copy & paste" formula for creating titles in the resource tab.

Learn exactly what to include in bullet points in order to increase conversion rates and narrow potential customers down the Amazon's sales funnel.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:65:"the-power-of-bullet-points-what-to-include-for-better-conversions";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6224186;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:17:"Bullet points.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-06-16T15:46:13Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:81;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:85;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2369804;s:5:"title";s:56:"Product description copywriting technique - step by step";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-06T21:14:04Z";s:11:"description";s:699:"

Description is below the fold, which means that not every visitor is going to read it. But those who do are probably on the fence of buying your product. This is the perfect place to create interest and evoke desire for your product, while providing additional details and information.

Also because product description has 2000 character limit, you want to use every single character because it will help you with ranking your product listing on Google search results. Off course don't overstuff with same keywords. Create unique, keyword-rich & engaging content.

In the resource tab I give you proven template that you can use for creating engaging product descriptions.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:54:"product-description-copywriting-technique-step-by-step";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4829614;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:60:"Product description copywriting technique - step by step.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-12-14T17:20:46Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:80;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:86;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5221854;s:5:"title";s:34:"UPDATED: Using HTML in description";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-06-01T16:18:13Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:33:"updated-using-html-in-description";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6125692;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:29:"Using HTML in description.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-06-01T16:19:54Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:79;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:87;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3194106;s:5:"title";s:38:"OLD LECTURE: Using HTML in description";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-07-03T13:45:04Z";s:11:"description";s:386:"

Amazon has recently sued several paid services and websites that offered positive product reviews for sale. This also affected sellers who used these services, since their Amazon seller accounts got suspended.

Learn how to spot fraud review services and avoid getting your Amazon seller account suspended.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:22:"how-not-to-get-reviews";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6100194;s:10:"asset_type";s:7:"Article";s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-05-28T15:11:03Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:71;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:95;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5436654;s:5:"title";s:77:"UPDATE: Reviews from highly discounted sales are NOT Verified reviews anymore";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-07-15T17:19:51Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:76:"update-reviews-from-highly-discounted-sales-are-not-verified-reviews-anymore";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6408310;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:96:"UPDATE Reviews from highly discounted products are not Verified reviews anymore - what to do.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-07-15T17:22:01Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:70;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:96;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8610126;s:5:"title";s:75:"Can a customer who bought a product at a discount be able to leave a review";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-21T19:16:55Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:75:"can-a-customer-who-bought-a-product-at-a-discount-be-able-to-leave-a-review";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10353660;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:81:"Can a customer who bought a product at a discount be able to leave a review e.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-21T19:33:42Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:69;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:97;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:623880;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-07T01:38:00Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:68;s:5:"title";s:9:"Promotion";s:11:"description";s:109:"Learn how to promote your product and drive highly targeted and prequalified traffic to your product listing.";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:98;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2370874;s:5:"title";s:30:"Leveraging other people's work";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-07T01:38:48Z";s:11:"description";s:443:"

Getting as many targeted visitors to your product offer is crucial, especially in the beginning stage.

Being endorsed by an authority and influencer in your niche who has large and engaged audience is one of the most powerful ways of promotion.

Learn how to find influencers within your niche manually or using special software.

This strategy should be applied on a regular basis, not just for product launches.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:29:"leveraging-other-peoples-work";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4828404;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:34:"Leveraging other people's work.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-12-14T14:07:27Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:67;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:99;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2509124;s:5:"title";s:48:"Giveaways - the right places and the right tools";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-01T22:01:40Z";s:11:"description";s:228:"

Let me explain what this module is about!

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:19:"module-introduction";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7985690;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"directives-01-intro.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-03-15T15:50:19Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:495;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:94;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6656164;s:5:"title";s:20:"ngFor and ngIf Recap";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-03-07T13:36:24Z";s:11:"description";s:73:"

We already learned about them, let's quickly recap ngIf and ngFor.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"ngfor-and-ngif-recap";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7986148;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:32:"directives-02-ngfor-and-ngif.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-03-15T16:20:52Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:494;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:95;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6656166;s:5:"title";s:25:"ngClass and ngStyle Recap";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-03-07T13:36:30Z";s:11:"description";s:92:"

We already know ngStyle and ngClass but let me quickly refresh our knowledge on them.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:25:"ngclass-and-ngstyle-recap";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:7986110;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:37:"directives-03-ngclass-and-ngstyle.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-03-15T16:15:35Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:493;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:96;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6656170;s:5:"title";s:36:"Creating a Basic Attribute Directive";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-03-07T13:36:40Z";s:11:"description";s:135:"

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:56:"using-the-renderer-to-build-a-better-attribute-directive";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:8000722;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:59:"directives-05-using-the-renderer-for-a-better-directive.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-03-17T14:49:12Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:491;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:98;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:6730946;s:5:"title";s:23:"More about the Renderer";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-03-20T16:44:34Z";s:11:"description";s:64:"

item.title: iOS 12 & Swift - The Complete iOS App Development Bootcamp
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: From Beginner to iOS 12 App Developer with Just One Course! Xcode 10 & Swift 4.2. Includes ARKit2, CoreML2 and CreateML.

a:4:{i:0;s:77:"No programming experience needed - I'll teach you everything you need to know";i:1;s:44:"A Mac laptop or iMac (or a PC running macOS)";i:2;s:80:"No paid software required - all apps will be created in Xcode 10 (which is free)";i:3;s:69:"I'll walk you through, step-by-step how to get Xcode installed set up";}

a:9:{i:0;s:33:"Be able to build any app you want";i:1;s:33:"Start your own app based business";i:2;s:85:"Create a portfolio of apps to apply for junior developer jobs at a technology company";i:3;s:62:"Become a digital nomad by working as a freelance iOS developer";i:4;s:65:"Master creating Augmented Reality apps using Apples new ARKit2";i:5;s:78:"Create apps that use Machine Learning using Apples new CoreML2 and CreateML";i:6;s:69:"Level-Up as an iOS developer by getting to grips with the latest APIs";i:7;s:85:"Master app design so you'll know how to wireframe, mockup and prototype your app idea";i:8;s:72:"Master app marketing so you can publish your apps and generate downloads";}
a:3:{i:0;s:33:"Be able to build any app you want";i:1;s:33:"Start your own app based business";i:2;s:85:"Create a portfolio of apps to apply for junior developer jobs at a technology company";}

a:4:{i:0;s:65:"If you are an absolute beginner to coding, then take this course.";i:1;s:228:"If you are a seasoned programmer, then take this course to to get up to speed quickly with Swift 4.2 and native app development. Start with the Xcode walkthrough lesson and we'll get you familiar with iOS development in no time!";i:2;s:168:"If you are switching from Objective-C to Swift then this is a fast-track way of doing it. You can get started straight away with the Intermediate Swift Language module.";i:3;s:146:"If you are a pro iOS developer and want to quickly get up to date with Apple's new iOS 12 APIs, then start with the modules on ARKit2 and CoreML2.";}

[{"question":"How long do I have access to the course materials?","answer":"You can view and review the lecture materials indefinitely, like an on-demand channel."},{"question":"Can I take my courses with me wherever I go?","answer":"Definitely! If you have an internet connection, courses on Udemy are available on any device at any time. If you don't have an internet connection, some instructors also let their students download course lectures. That's up to the instructor though, so make sure you get on their good side!"}]

item.title: The Complete JavaScript Course 2018: Build Real Projects!
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Master JavaScript with the most complete course on the market! Projects, challenges, quizzes, ES6+, OOP, AJAX, Webpack

a:3:{i:0;s:90:"No coding experience is necessary to take this course! I take you from beginner to expert!";i:1;s:102:"Any computer and OS will work Windows, macOS or Linux. We will set up your text editor the course.";i:2;s:123:"A basic understanding of HTML and CSS is a plus, but not a must! The course includes a 5-minutes HTML and CSS crash course.";}

a:12:{i:0;s:60:"Go from a total beginner to an advanced JavaScript developer";i:1;s:76:"Code 3 beautiful real-world apps with both ES5 and ES6+ (no boring toy apps)";i:2;s:106:"JavaScript and programming fundamentals: variables, boolean logic, if/else, loops, functions, arrays, etc.";i:3;s:120:"Complex features like the 'this' keyword, function constructors, prototypal inheritance, first-class functions, closures";i:4;s:77:"Asynchronous JavaScript: The event loop, promises, async/await, AJAX and APIs";i:5;s:63:"Modern JavaScript for 2018: NPM, Webpack, Babel and ES6 modules";i:6;s:62:"A true understanding of how JavaScript works behind the scenes";i:7;s:78:"What's new in ES6: arrow functions, classes, default and rest parameters, etc.";i:8;s:68:"Practice your new skills with coding challenges (solutions included)";i:9;s:71:"Organize and structure your code using JavaScript patterns like modules";i:10;s:47:"Get friendly and fast support in the course Q&A";i:11;s:62:"Downloadable lectures, code and design assets for all projects";}

a:3:{i:0;s:60:"Go from a total beginner to an advanced JavaScript developer";i:1;s:76:"Code 3 beautiful real-world apps with both ES5 and ES6+ (no boring toy apps)";i:2;s:106:"JavaScript and programming fundamentals: variables, boolean logic, if/else, loops, functions, arrays, etc.";}

a:4:{i:0;s:124:"Take this course if you want to gain a deep understanding of the most popular programming language in the world: JavaScript.";i:1;s:199:"Take this course if you have taken other JavaScript courses but: 1) still don't really understand JavaScript, or 2) still don't feel confident to code real-world apps. This course is perfect for you!";i:2;s:104:"Take this course if you're interested in using popular libraries/frameworks like React, Angular or Node.";i:3;s:125:"Take this course if you want to get started with programming in general: JavaScript is a great language to learn how to code.";}

[{"answer":"You can view and review the lecture materials indefinitely, like an on-demand channel.","question":"How long do I have access to the course materials?"},{"answer":"Definitely! If you have an internet connection, courses on Udemy are available on any device at any time. If you don't have an internet connection, some instructors also let their students download course lectures. That's up to the instructor though, so make sure you get on their good side!","question":"Can I take my courses with me wherever I go?"}]

item.title: The Complete Node.js Developer Course (2nd Edition)
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Learn Node.js by building real-world applications with Node, Express, MongoDB, Mocha, and more!
a:2:{i:0;s:71:"A computer on which you can install software (Windows, MacOS, or Linux)";i:1;s:90:"A basic understanding of JavaScript (variables, functions, objects, arrays, if statements)";}

a:6:{i:0;s:33:"Build, test, and launch Node apps";i:1;s:35:"Create Express web servers and APIs";i:2;s:36:"Store data with Mongoose and MongoDB";i:3;s:35:"Use cutting-edge ES6/ES7 JavaScript";i:4;s:35:"Deploy your Node apps to production";i:5;s:39:"Create real-time web apps with SocketIO";}

[{"answer":"You can view and review the lecture materials indefinitely, like an on-demand channel.","question":"How long do I have access to the course materials?"},{"answer":"Definitely! If you have an internet connection, courses on Udemy are available on any device at any time. If you don't have an internet connection, some instructors also let their students download course lectures. That's up to the instructor though, so make sure you get on their good side!","question":"Can I take my courses with me wherever I go?"}]

item.title: React 16 - The Complete Guide (incl. React Router 4 & Redux)
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Dive in and learn React from scratch! Learn Reactjs, Redux, React Routing, Animations, Next.js basics and way more!

a:4:{i:0;s:60:"JavaScript + HTML + CSS fundamentals are absolutely required";i:1;s:67:"You DON'T need to be a JavaScript expert to succeed in this course!";i:2;s:59:"ES6+ JavaScript knowledge is beneficial but not a must-have";i:3;s:64:"NO prior React or any other JS framework experience is required!";}

a:4:{s:5:"count";i:460;s:4:"next";s:91:"https://www.udemy.com/api-2.0/courses/1362070/public-curriculum-items/?page=2&page_size=100";s:8:"previous";N;s:7:"results";a:100:{i:0;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:1961692;s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-09-26T22:23:16Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:461;s:5:"title";s:15:"Getting Started";s:11:"description";s:99:"Students will understand what React is, why and when to use it and what to expect from this course.";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:1;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8090834;s:5:"title";s:12:"Introduction";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-09-26T22:23:16Z";s:11:"description";s:104:"

Let me introduce you to this module and to the course in general - welcome on board! :)

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:12:"introduction";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10006604;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:35:"getting-started-01-introduction.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-23T14:56:25Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:460;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:2;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8268490;s:5:"title";s:14:"What is React?";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-17T00:28:14Z";s:11:"description";s:125:"

Let's dive into the most important question first: What is React? In this lecture, we'll take a closer look.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:13:"what-is-react";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9967332;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:36:"getting-started-02-what-is-react.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-19T19:27:48Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:459;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:3;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8268492;s:5:"title";s:32:"Real-World SPAs & React Web Apps";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-17T00:28:55Z";s:11:"description";s:186:"

We learned what React is but it's always more useful to see real-world examples. So let's dive into some web pages that use React or a similar framework/ approach in this lecture.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:30:"real-world-spas-react-web-apps";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9973310;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:47:"getting-started-03-real-life-react-web-apps.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-20T06:56:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:458;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:4;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:9409752;s:5:"title";s:41:"Adding the Right React Version to Codepen";s:7:"created";s:20:"2018-02-17T08:10:46Z";s:11:"description";s:114:"

There might be an error when adding React-DOM to Codepen. Use the solution shown in this lecture to fix it.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:41:"adding-the-right-react-version-to-codepen";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:11360254;s:10:"asset_type";s:7:"Article";s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:7:"created";s:20:"2018-02-17T08:13:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:457;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:5;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8268496;s:5:"title";s:28:"Writing our First React Code";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-17T00:29:22Z";s:11:"description";s:112:"

With the theory out of the way: Let's dive into React and let's actually write our first React code.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:28:"writing-our-first-react-code";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9973284;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:51:"getting-started-04-writing-our-first-react-code.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-20T06:56:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:456;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:6;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8268498;s:5:"title";s:27:"Why Should we Choose React?";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-17T00:29:40Z";s:11:"description";s:163:"

Why React? Why not vanilla JavaScript? What's the advantage of picking a library like React? These answers will get answered in this lecture.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:26:"why-should-we-choose-react";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9973252;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:32:"getting-started-05-why-react.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-20T06:56:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:455;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:7;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8268500;s:5:"title";s:18:"React Alternatives";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-17T00:30:01Z";s:11:"description";s:110:"

React's not the only library you can dive into. Let's take a closer look at some alternatives you have.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:18:"react-alternatives";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9973280;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:46:"getting-started-06-looking-at-alternatives.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-20T06:56:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:454;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:8;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8268506;s:5:"title";s:66:"Understanding Single Page Applications and Multi Page Applications";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-17T00:30:24Z";s:11:"description";s:178:"

With React, you frequently create Single Page Applications. Now what does that mean? What is a Single Page Application? This lecture will answer these questions.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:66:"understanding-single-page-applications-and-multi-page-applications";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9973328;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:33:"getting-started-07-spa-vs-mpa.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-20T06:56:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:453;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:9;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8268510;s:5:"title";s:14:"Course Outline";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-17T00:30:55Z";s:11:"description";s:123:"

You now know what React is but what does the course actually offer you? This lecture will answer that question.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:14:"course-outline";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10006030;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:37:"getting-started-08-course-outline.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-23T14:00:00Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:452;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:10;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8268512;s:5:"title";s:38:"How to get the Most out of This Course";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-17T00:31:17Z";s:11:"description";s:128:"

There's more than one way of taking a course. Let's find out how you can get the most out of this course in this lecture.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:38:"how-to-get-the-most-out-of-this-course";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9973308;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:58:"getting-started-10-getting-the-most-out-of-this-course.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-20T06:56:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:451;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:11;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8145364;s:5:"title";s:24:"Useful Resources & Links";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-03T15:15:50Z";s:11:"description";s:119:"

This lecture contains some useful resources and links. It also holds all the code for the module attached to it.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:22:"useful-resources-links";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9964288;s:10:"asset_type";s:7:"Article";s:5:"title";s:0:"";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-19T14:52:29Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:450;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:12;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:1989006;s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-10T20:42:29Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:449;s:5:"title";s:48:"Refreshing Next Generation JavaScript (Optional)";s:11:"description";s:138:"Students will understand the next-gen JavaScript features you typically use in React apps (and which we therefore also use in the course).";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:13;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8211776;s:5:"title";s:19:"Module Introduction";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-10T20:43:37Z";s:11:"description";s:83:"

Let me introduce you to this module and to what you're going to learn in it.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:19:"module-introduction";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9962678;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:39:"next-gen-javascript-01-introduction.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-19T12:15:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:448;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:14;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8211784;s:5:"title";s:31:"Understanding "let" and "const"";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-10T20:44:40Z";s:11:"description";s:186:"

One important next-gen feature you're going to see a lot is the usage of "const" and "let" instead of "var". What's up with these keywords? This lecture answers the question.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"understanding-let-and-const";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9962650;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:54:"next-gen-javascript-02-understanding-let-and-const.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-19T12:15:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:447;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:15;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8211786;s:5:"title";s:15:"Arrow Functions";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-10T20:44:45Z";s:11:"description";s:160:"

Arrow functions are another key next-gen feature we'll heavily use in this course. Let's dive into how to write them and how to use them in this lecture.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:15:"arrow-functions";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9962670;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:55:"next-gen-javascript-03-working-with-arrow-functions.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-19T12:15:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:446;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:16;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8211788;s:5:"title";s:19:"Exports and Imports";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-10T20:44:53Z";s:11:"description";s:237:"

We'll write modular code in this course. That means, that the code will be split up across multiple files. In order to connect these files correctly, we'll need imports and exports. So let's dive into that feature in this lecture.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:38:"component-updating-lifecycle-in-action";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9762918;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:60:"component-deep-dive-09-implementing-update-related-hooks.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-01T12:27:03Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:365;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:97;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8103752;s:5:"title";s:53:"Updating Lifecycle Hooks (Triggered by State Changes)";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-09-28T11:15:36Z";s:11:"description";s:123:"

Finally, we have two ways of updating components - the lifecycles also vary slightly. Time to find out what differs.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:51:"updating-lifecycle-hooks-triggered-by-state-changes";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9763020;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:65:"component-deep-dive-10-lifecycle-updating-by-internal-changes.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-01T12:27:03Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:364;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:98;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8103756;s:5:"title";s:37:"Performance Gains with PureComponents";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-09-28T11:15:44Z";s:11:"description";s:162:"

shouldComponentUpdate is an important lifecycle method - we can have an easier time optimizing the component performance though. Let's explore the options.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:37:"performance-gains-with-purecomponents";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9763078;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:64:"component-deep-dive-11-performance-gains-with-purecomponents.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-01T12:27:04Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:363;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:99;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8103760;s:5:"title";s:42:"How React Updates the App & Component Tree";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-09-28T11:15:54Z";s:11:"description";s:145:"

We're already taking a closer look under the React hood. Let's continue this road and find out how it actually updates the component tree.

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Web UI UX Design using Adobe XD - User Experience Design
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Use XD to get a job in UI Design, User Interface, User Experience design, UX design & Web Design

a:3:{i:0;s:90:"You will need a copy of Adobe XD 2019 or above. A free trial can be downloaded from Adobe.";i:1;s:40:"No previous design experience is needed.";i:2;s:39:"No previous Adobe XD skills are needed.";}

a:29:{i:0;s:21:"Become a UX designer.";i:1;s:60:"You will be able to start earning money from your XD Skills.";i:2;s:46:"You will be able to add UX designer to your CV";i:3;s:41:"Build a UX project from beginning to end.";i:4;s:21:"Become a UI designer.";i:5;s:31:"Build & test a full mobile app.";i:6;s:35:"Build & test a full website design.";i:7;s:61:"You will have a project of your own to add to your portfolio.";i:8;s:53:"42 lectures of well-structured, step by step content.";i:9;s:45:"Learn to design websites & mobile phone apps.";i:10;s:25:"Work with fonts & colors.";i:11;s:41:"Prototype your designs with interactions.";i:12;s:22:"Test on mobile phones.";i:13;s:67:"You'll create realistic prototype complete with micro interactions.";i:14;s:44:"Send your designs for feedback & commenting.";i:15;s:31:"Export production ready assets.";i:16;s:37:"Create your first UX brief & persona.";i:17;s:24:"Create quick wireframes.";i:18;s:27:"How to use premade UI kits.";i:19;s:47:"Learn professional workflow tricks & shortcuts.";i:20;s:56:"You will get the finished files so you never fall behind";i:21;s:27:"Downloadable exercise files";i:22;s:51:"Forum support from me and the rest of the BYOL crew";i:23;s:43:"All the techniques used by UX professionals";i:24;s:62:"Build a mobile app prototype that responses to voice commands.";i:25;s:70:"You will be able to talk correctly with other UX design professionals.";i:26;s:34:"You'll learn how to choose colors.";i:27;s:43:"You'll learn how to pick the correct fonts.";i:28;s:88:"You'll be able to send your finished work to other professionals in the correct formats.";}

a:2:{i:0;a:9:{s:6:"_class";s:4:"user";s:5:"title";s:19:"Daniel Walter Scott";s:4:"name";s:13:"Daniel Walter";s:12:"display_name";s:19:"Daniel Walter Scott";s:9:"job_title";s:51:"Adobe Certified Instructor & Adobe Certified Expert";s:11:"image_50x50";s:59:"https://udemy-images.udemy.com/user/50x50/11614232_b0fc.jpg";s:13:"image_100x100";s:61:"https://udemy-images.udemy.com/user/100x100/11614232_b0fc.jpg";s:8:"initials";s:2:"DS";s:3:"url";s:24:"/user/danielwalterscott/";}i:1;a:9:{s:6:"_class";s:4:"user";s:5:"title";s:13:"Instructor HQ";s:4:"name";s:10:"Instructor";s:12:"display_name";s:13:"Instructor HQ";s:9:"job_title";s:48:"Streamline your online course creation processes";s:11:"image_50x50";s:62:"https://udemy-images.udemy.com/user/50x50/43638900_0b92_10.jpg";s:13:"image_100x100";s:64:"https://udemy-images.udemy.com/user/100x100/43638900_0b92_10.jpg";s:8:"initials";s:2:"IH";s:3:"url";s:26:"/user/daniel-walter-scott/";}}

a:4:{s:5:"count";i:46;s:4:"next";N;s:8:"previous";N;s:7:"results";a:46:{i:0;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:2100396;s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-29T23:44:55Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:47;s:5:"title";s:8:"Overview";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:1;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679718;s:5:"title";s:12:"Introduction";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-29T23:44:55Z";s:11:"description";s:586:"

Hi there, my name is Dan, and I'm an Adobe Certified Instructor. Now together, you and me, are going to learn how to use Adobe XD.

Now, this UI/UX design tool is going to help us create beautiful user interfaces as well as streamlining our user experience. During this course, we're going to use an actual freelance project I'm working on. The project needs both a web interface and a mobile app. So it's going to give you a really good understanding of how to run your own potential UX project. And my course here is aimed at people new to Design, and those experienced.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:12:"introduction";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445516;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:26:"01 Intro - XD Oct 2017.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:46;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:2;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679802;s:5:"title";s:42:"Getting started with your Adobe XD project";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:07:27Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:42:"getting-started-with-your-adobe-xd-project";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445570;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:49:"02 Getting started with your Adobe XD project.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:45;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:3;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679804;s:5:"title";s:52:"What is UI vs UX - User Interface vs User Experience";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:07:31Z";s:11:"description";s:296:"

Before we get started, we'll just quickly cover what UX versus UI is. If you're new to the field, they kind of get bandied around together. UX is more of an umbrella term. It covers a lot of components including UI. So UI, User Interface Design is what we're going to cover in this course.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:50:"what-is-ui-vs-ux-user-interface-vs-user-experience";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445504;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:59:"03 What is UI vs UX - User Interface vs User Experience.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:44;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:4;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679806;s:5:"title";s:45:"The brief & persona for our real life project";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:07:34Z";s:11:"description";s:450:"

So before we get started I want to quickly just outline the brief for this project. This is an actual project from one of my clients. I thought that would be a nice way to explore XD, through an actual project.

So what we had to do, there's kind of UX research side of things, and we had to build out a client brief, which I'll show you here. And we had to build out the Persona, just like who the target audience is going to be. 

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:43:"the-brief-persona-for-our-real-life-project";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445580;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:54:"04 The brief & persona for our real life project B.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:43;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:5;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:2100418;s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:14:01Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:42;s:5:"title";s:24:"Wireframing Low Fidelity";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:6;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679814;s:5:"title";s:38:"Wireframing (low fidelity) in Adobe XD";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:14:05Z";s:11:"description";s:212:"

Hey there, to get started you need to download the exercise files. There'll be a link in the comments or description below. Sometimes there's a button, you're looking out for the 'Download Exercise Files'.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:36:"wireframing-low-fidelity-in-adobe-xd";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445512;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:45:"05 Wireframing (low fidelity) in Adobe XD.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:41;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:7;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679816;s:5:"title";s:41:"Working with existing UI kits in Adobe XD";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:14:10Z";s:11:"description";s:289:"

Hi there, in this tutorial we're going to get our page started here. We're going to go to page, get it to have a navigation. We're going to pull it from some of the templates that are built in from XD, and make it look like this. All right, let's get into it, and get started in XD.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:41:"working-with-existing-ui-kits-in-adobe-xd";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445506;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:48:"06 Working with existing UI kits in Adobe XD.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:40;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:8;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679818;s:5:"title";s:39:"Working with type in your XD wireframes";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:14:15Z";s:11:"description";s:338:"

Hi there, in this video we're going to look at Type in XD. We're going to update some of the Nav here. We're going to talk about what fonts we can use, and can't use. We'll do some aligning and distributing, and we'll update the logo here, in the top left. Exciting. Not really, but some essential stuff, so let's get in and do it.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:39:"working-with-type-in-your-xd-wireframes";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445514;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:46:"07 Working with type in your XD wireframes.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:39;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:9;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679860;s:5:"title";s:53:"How to create forms, checkboxes & buttons in Adobe XD";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:21:59Z";s:11:"description";s:785:"

Hi there, in this video we're going to make some Input boxes and some Checkboxes, and a Button. We'll also look at creating our first Character Style. So let's go and start creating now.

The first thing I want to do is, I'm going to grab the Rectangle tool and just divide off a bit of space. This is going to be my On Boarding Box. It's above the fold, it's my most important. It's asking people to kind of become a member, or at least test their course. So what I'd like to do is-- I'm happy with the white Fill. The border here, I'm going to change it a little bit to be dark. You know, I said don't spend too much time picking fonts and colors. I can't help myself sometimes. I've just picked a slightly darker gray. I'm going to use this gray throughout the course.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:50:"how-to-create-forms-checkboxes-buttons-in-adobe-xd";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445510;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:60:"08 How to create forms, checkboxes & buttons in Adobe XD.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:38;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:10;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679862;s:5:"title";s:45:"Free icons for your Adobe XD & UX UI projects";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:22:03Z";s:11:"description";s:364:"

Hey there, in this video we're going to go and find icons. You can see, the video here, there's a new icon there, there's Image1. So we're going to go and show you the main places to go and gather consistent icons. There's three main places. And then we'll lay out this real quick. Just to rest the page, or chuck in our Footer. So let's go and do that now.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:43:"free-icons-for-your-adobe-xd-ux-ui-projects";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445508;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:59:"09 Free icons for your Adobe XD & UX UI projects.cmproj.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:37;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:11;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8679866;s:5:"title";s:46:"Prototyping & adding interactivity to Adobe XD";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:22:08Z";s:11:"description";s:430:"

Hi there, welcome to this tutorial where we're going to start Prototyping, and adding a bit of interaction. You can see these wires hanging around here. What happens is, when I hit 'Play' I can hit 'Preview', then close it down, and go back. It is the feature requests for XD, or bugs. It's a way for you to go through as a user and say we really need underlining, and up-vote it, and look at the other ones, up-vote what you think because whatever gets to the top of the voting pile, Adobe XD would do next. So a handy little thing to go in and say yes we need these features quick smart. All right, let's go in and do it.

Actually just going to destroy it. Hit 'Save', it means that Photoshop mockup updates automatically. And if I go to XD, give it a second and XD updates as well. Makes it super useful when you are kind of half way through things like designing logos, like I am for this product; CC Libraries rule. Let's go learn how to use that now in XD, Photoshop, and Illustrator.

We close it back up, all nicely faked in XD, plus in our apps, we can have navigation push in, push back out, and we can have nice little search boxes, click back out. Lastly we can add things to cart, and they appear in that little cart here. Let's go look now how to make these using Adobe XD Prototype.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:61:"advanced-prototyping-using-buttons-dropdown-menus-in-adobe-xd";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445576;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:70:"36 Advanced prototyping using buttons & dropdown menus in Adobe XD.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:9;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:39;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8680224;s:5:"title";s:59:"One more Prototype trick & faking depth of field for mockup";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T01:14:47Z";s:11:"description";s:315:"

Hey there, in this tutorial we're going to look at one more trick for Prototyping, and we'll go and build this list. Actually I've already built it but I want to show you how to do this kind of prospective blurring the background drop shadowy type thing. All right, let's go and do that now in this tutorial.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:57:"one-more-prototype-trick-faking-depth-of-field-for-mockup";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445554;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:73:"37 One more Prototype trick & faking depth of field for mockup.cmproj.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:8;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:40;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8680228;s:5:"title";s:27:"UX User Testing in Adobe XD";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T01:14:51Z";s:11:"description";s:551:"

So we've built out our prototyping to go out to user testing now. We've got the interactions, working through prototyping tools, we've built out all the graphics, so it looks like a working project. So we're ready for user testing.

In this project I'm going to do just couple of basic user tests. We're going to do some moderated user testing, also known as Hallway testing or Over the Shoulder testing. What that means is that, the client's given us names of couple of people that would be really good potential matches to our persona.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"ux-user-testing-in-adobe-xd";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445566;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:38:"38 UX User Testing in Adobe XD.MP4.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:7;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:41;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8680230;s:5:"title";s:56:"How to export images & code from Adobe XD for developers";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T01:14:56Z";s:11:"description";s:403:"

Hey there, in this video we're going to export images, and all of our code and everything we need for our website or app to be built by a developer. It's super cool, we can click on things, get measurements, it's all web based so your developer doesn't need any XD experience. They can just go to a website and pull everything they need down. Let's go and learn how to do that now using Adobe XD.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:54:"how-to-export-images-code-from-adobe-xd-for-developers";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445582;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:63:"39 How to export images & code from Adobe XD for developers.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:6;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:42;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:2100494;s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T01:15:03Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:4;s:5:"title";s:9:"What Next";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:43;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8680232;s:5:"title";s:26:"Class Project for Adobe XD";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T01:15:08Z";s:11:"description";s:273:"

So it's Class Project time. This looks a little daunting, but I want to give you some boundaries. Yes, it's hard to do a project on your own for your own portfolio without some sort of restrictions. So you can adopt as much of this or as little of this, as you want.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:26:"class-project-for-adobe-xd";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445558;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:40:"40 Class Project for Adobe XD.cmproj.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:3;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:44;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8680234;s:5:"title";s:36:"Shortcuts & Cheat Sheet for Adobe XD";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T01:15:12Z";s:11:"description";s:414:"

All right, time for some shortcut cheap sheet goodness. The first one is 'Control Tab'. Now that's 'Control Tab' on both Mac and a PC. The only shortcut in the world that is the same. So hold down 'Control' on your keyboard, tap 'Tab' and you'll jump between Prototype - you see that at the top here - and Design Mode. 'Control Tab', super nice. And we're back to Design mode, using my handy dandy shortcut.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"shortcuts-cheat-sheet-for-adobe-xd";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445562;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:50:"41 Shortcuts & Cheat Sheet for Adobe XD.cmproj.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:2;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:45;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8680236;s:5:"title";s:39:"Conclusion for Adobe XD training course";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T01:15:15Z";s:11:"description";s:411:"

All right, we're at the end, you made it, I'm here, we're both here. XD is awesome. So, we are finished now.

Couple of things, is, any comments, use the comments underneath your pages. I'm pretty good at replying. Also, the projects, go and do the class project, leave the link. Leave the JPEGs and comment on anybody else's as well. That sort of feedback really helps everybody get a bit better.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:39:"conclusion-for-adobe-xd-training-course";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10445556;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:50:"42 Conclusion for Adobe XD training course.MP4.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-11-30T00:02:07Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:1;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}}}

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:40:"styling-the-navigation-for-small-screens";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2003930;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:33:"C-Week-3-Lecture-04-Small-Nav.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2014-10-13T19:35:25Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:16;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:25;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:1170;s:7:"created";s:20:"2011-08-31T02:03:54Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:15;s:5:"title";s:33:"Getting Started (Original Course)";s:11:"description";N;s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:26;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:44393;s:5:"title";s:12:"Introduction";s:7:"created";s:20:"2011-08-01T21:29:06Z";s:11:"description";s:118:"

This introducion shows this web design final project adapting to various browsers, platforms, and screen sizes.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:12:"introduction";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:4691:"Hi. This is Chris Converse of Codified Design Studio. And this is a course I've put together in creating multi-screen web design. So what I want to do in this introduction is show you the final project that we're going to be creating. So I'm going to open this HTML file up in a browser. So what we're doing here is using HTML 5 and CSS3 Media Queries to create a design that can change or manipulate itself based on the view port of the browser browsing your website. So what I'm going to do here is take this web window and open it up. And when we get higher than 980 pixels, the design's going to lock itself down and then center in the browser. When I get below 980 pixels, we're going to set the design up to be liquid or fluid so that all of the items in the page will actually stretch to conform to the overall width of the browser. When I come under a certain pixel width, in this case 500 pixels, notice that the design and the banner changed from a larger banner, and a larger logo, and a larger sidebar photo to a much smaller banner size, much smaller buttons, more spaced-out. The assumption here is that we're probably on a tablet device because we're under 800 pixels on the horizontal. So I spaced out the buttons to make sure you can tap them with your fingers. And then when we get even smaller, under 500 pixels, we rearrange the content altogether. We take the sidebar and move it under the content. And we even take those links at the top and move them down to be underneath the content. So if somebody visits this same page on a mobile device, they can flick their finger down to the bottom and then use the navigation content links once they've finished reading the content. Now I did mention that we'll be using HTML 5. There are some older browsers that don't support HTML 5 and some CSS3 attributes. So what we're going to do in here is we're going to make use of a Google Shiv, that's an HTML 5 Java Script enabler for IE7 and 8. So here we are inside of IE7 which is using semi-transparency based on an alternate style sheet. And it's even rendering the heading area which is an HTML 5 tag, a footer area which is an HTML 5 tag, and a navigation item up here which is also HTML 5. So while IE7 does not support the device sensitive layout changing, we do see the layout working correctly in IE7. If we hop over to IE9 running in Windows 7, we can see the device is working over here as well. I can even close this down because IE9 has device sensitivity as well. So I can scroll down here and see the button showing up down at the bottom. But what makes this so powerful is that we can run the same content in devices as well. So here's the same design running on an iPad in the simulator here. And if I rotate the screen, I can see that the device will actually change. In this case, we see this medium screen display versus the large screen display. One thing you might notice on iOS devices, the phone and iPad, we might have to pinch down to change, but here we're seeing that full computer screen size. In addition, let's hop over to Android. So inside the Android environment, we can see Android on a horizontal. It's showing me the tablet view. And I'll hit Ctrl-F11 in the simulator here, and take a look at the Android rendering this page with the width similar to the phone views. Now I can tap and scroll down here, and see the button showing up at the bottom as we would see it on a mobile Android phone. So during this course, we're going to be creating the HTML and CSS files necessary to make all of these layouts happen across all of these different screen sizes. And so one of the things we're going to do is be referring back to a sketch. So I always prefer creating a sketch of your interactive projects. This gives us the ability to figure out some of the measurements, figure out our strategy as far as HTML and CSS is concerned, and give us an idea of when we're in the HTML and CSS of what some of the measurements are going to be. So in this sketch here, we've actually defined out how we're going to have the design changing. So we've seen this working in all the different browsers. And this is the sketch we came up with to sort of figure out what's going to happen. Figure out the fact that the navigation is actually going to move from the top area on both the computer and table area to moving down to being under the content on the mobile phone area. We're also taking these content areas, the left side and right side content container, and shifting them to be vertical when we switch over to the handheld device as well. So I hope this course sounds interesting to you. And if it does, let's get started with the first movie.";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:37509;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"Introduction";s:7:"created";s:20:"2011-08-01T21:29:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:14;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:27;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:44394;s:5:"title";s:24:"Review the Project Files";s:7:"created";s:20:"2011-08-01T21:32:04Z";s:11:"description";s:66:"

A quick walkthrough of the files provided with this course.
