item.title: Responsive Design HTML CSS Web design - Dreamweaver CC
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Learn HTML5 & CSS3 web design skills. Build beautiful responsive design websites in Dreamweaver CC

a:3:{i:0;s:102:"You will need a copy of Adobe Dreamweaver CC 2017 or above. A free trial can be downloaded from Adobe.";i:1;s:41:"No previous web design skills are needed.";i:2;s:42:"No previous Dreamweaver skills are needed.";}

a:15:{i:0;s:48:"39 lectures 3+ hours of well-structured content!";i:1;s:66:"You'll learn to build a responsive portfolio website from scratch.";i:2;s:76:"Learn how to take a design from Illustrator & create a professional website.";i:3;s:36:"How to use templates in Dreamweaver.";i:4;s:56:"Create mobile, tablet & desktop versions of the website.";i:5;s:60:"Build our own custom responsive navigation with burger menu.";i:6;s:36:"Introduction to JavaScript & jQuery.";i:7;s:44:"How to publish your website to the internet.";i:8;s:60:"Ways to preview your designs straight to your mobile device.";i:9;s:47:"How to get the most from your portfolio Images.";i:10;s:47:"How to use beautiful web fonts in your designs.";i:11;s:57:"You will get the finished files so you never fall behind.";i:12;s:42:"Downloadable exercise files & cheat sheet.";i:13;s:52:"Forum support from me and the rest of the BYOL crew.";i:14;s:58:"All the techniques used by professional website designers.";}

a:3:{i:0;s:48:"39 lectures 3+ hours of well-structured content!";i:1;s:66:"You'll learn to build a responsive portfolio website from scratch.";i:2;s:76:"Learn how to take a design from Illustrator & create a professional website.";}

a:2:{i:0;s:131:"YES: This course is for beginners. Aimed at people new to the world of web design. No previous Dreamweaver experience is necessary.";i:1;s:72:"NO: This course is NOT suited to people experienced in using HTML & CSS.";}

[{"question":"How long do I have access to the course materials?","answer":"You can view and review the lecture materials indefinitely, like an on-demand channel."},{"question":"Can I take my courses with me wherever I go?","answer":"Definitely! If you have an internet connection, courses on Udemy are available on any device at any time. If you don't have an internet connection, some instructors also let their students download course lectures. That's up to the instructor though, so make sure you get on their good side!"}]

Hi there, my name is Dan. And in this video series we're going to make this Responsive Portfolio Website using Dreamweaver. Now we're going to go through this course step by step learning everything we need to know to make a website.

Hi, so what are we going to be making in this course and what are the resources? We're going to be taking a design that we've made in a previous completely different class. It was for Web & UI Design using Illustrator. You don't have to have done that course, it's quite handy if you do want to do the Design process as well as the Build. So you can go do that. But well be taking that design and turning it into a fully Responsive Website using Dreamweaver.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:47:"what-well-be-building-resources-for-this-course";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9549474;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"02 exercise files.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-09-11T01:41:16Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:47;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:3;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:1929588;s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-09-07T22:01:53Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:46;s:5:"title";s:39:"Creating an HTML Website in Dreamweaver";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:4;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:7938260;s:5:"title";s:47:"Setting up Adobe Dreamweaver to create websites";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-09-08T00:54:05Z";s:11:"description";s:386:"

Hi there, in this video we're going to set up our Work Space so that we can design amazing websites. item.title: Adobe Illustrator for Mobile Game Art - A Beginners Guide
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Create mobile game art in Adobe illustrator just by using basic concepts, essential tools and proven workflows.

a:6:{i:0;s:66:"No Prior knowledge of Adobe Illustrator or any art concept needed!";i:1;s:97:"Adobe Illustrator CS4 and up! or other vector program which has similar tools that I will discuss";i:2;s:108:"Your dedicated time and 100% attention. You will be thought with the basics and pro tips at the same time. ";i:3;s:133:"Know at least basic commands in Illustrator or already knows how to navigate. If you are completely new to the software. Even Better!";i:4;s:135:"An open, inquiring mind-its best if you have illustrator open at the same time so you can follow along. Experience is your best Teacher";i:5;s:75:"Keep in mind that there are no shortcuts, only faster ways of doing things!";}

a:8:{i:0;s:56:"Learn how to make mobile game art with Adobe Illustrator";i:1;s:105:"Learn the fundamentals of mobile game art creation. From concepts and theories to real world applications";i:2;s:64:"Learn how to use the right tools necessary for game art creation";i:3;s:90:"Learn the best practices and workflows when making game art and speed up your workflow 10x";i:4;s:123:"Have the proper mindset when creating game art, be a lot more creative and look at things from a professional artists eyes.";i:5;s:70:"Create mobile game art with with no in-depth knowledge of Art concepts";i:6;s:107:"Appreciate Game Art creation and choose to either make it a fun hobby or one of the best jobs in the world!";i:7;s:76:"Use this real world knowledge for your App Flipping Business (graphics only)";}

before we can confortably work in photoshop, lets take some time to learn the basic tools and some tricks to feel more at ease with photoshop it self. You'll learn how to create, duplicate and move layers. And also how to copy parts of a layer onto a new one, or onto itself.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:22:"working-with-photoshop";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2725520;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:16:"00.photoshop.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-17T20:03:53Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:111;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:5;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260084;s:5:"title";s:35:"Configuring the tools for pixel art";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:49:17Z";s:11:"description";s:221:"

Using Photoshop for pixel art is perfectly fine, but give that its a very complex software with loads of features, we want to make sure that our tools are set specifically to work with pixel level illustrations

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:35:"configuring-the-tools-for-pixel-art";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531432;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"01.ConfiguringTools.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T12:17:58Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:110;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:6;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260092;s:5:"title";s:14:"Creating lines";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:51:51Z";s:11:"description";s:224:"

Drawing a line isn't just a matter of creating pixels next to each other. there are optimal line directions and optimal placement of pixel, to suggest a specific shape. In pixel art, every single pixel counts.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:14:"creating-lines";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531402;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:19:"02.DrawingLines.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T12:12:14Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:109;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:7;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260094;s:5:"title";s:16:"Creating circles";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:52:03Z";s:11:"description";s:317:"

Since a circle is the smoothest shape you can draw, its also the most complicated one to replicate in pixel art, while still ensuring it doesn't look like something else. In this lecture, I'll guide you through the smallest sizes you can draw a circle in, and what are the best aproaches.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:16:"creating-circles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531412;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"03.DrawingCircles.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T12:13:53Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:108;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:8;a:14:{s:6:"_class";s:4:"quiz";s:2:"id";i:115694;s:5:"title";s:28:"Creating Pixel art - Lineart";s:4:"type";s:11:"simple-quiz";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-20T16:01:04Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"sort_order";i:107;s:12:"object_index";i:1;s:8:"is_draft";b:0;s:7:"version";i:1;s:8:"duration";N;s:12:"pass_percent";N;}i:9;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260098;s:5:"title";s:36:"Drawing your first sprite - a Sword!";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:52:24Z";s:11:"description";s:197:"

With the fundamentals or line and shape drawing, its time to draw your first sprite: A Sword!
We will create a simple shape, and fill it in with simplistic and flat colors.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:33:"drawing-your-first-sprite-a-sword";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531418;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:18:"04.SwordSprite.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T12:15:00Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:106;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:10;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2392510;s:5:"title";s:36:"Exercise - trace over a book drawing";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-10T17:25:44Z";s:11:"description";s:342:"

Use this photoshop file to practice tracing over a drawing. Use the layer above all the others, and with the pencil tool create a line as clean as you can, over what YOU think, are the most important features on the drawing.If you are not using photoshop, you can use the png version of the file that you can find in the resources.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"exercise-trace-over-a-book-drawing";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2677896;s:10:"asset_type";s:4:"File";s:5:"title";s:8:"book.psd";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-10T17:27:03Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:105;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:11;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2385720;s:5:"title";s:20:"Conclusion section 2";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:22:32Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"conclusion-section-2";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2670950;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"section2.mov";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:27:44Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:104;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:12;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:596394;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:52:45Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:103;s:5:"title";s:28:"Creating pixel art - Shading";s:11:"description";s:96:"Once you've mastered the creationg of pixelated line art, its time to fill that in with shading!";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:13;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2384812;s:5:"title";s:25:"Shading in the real world";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T18:07:30Z";s:11:"description";s:140:"

Before we can shade in pixel art, we should look at some real life examples, and see how light affects different surfaces

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:25:"shading-in-the-real-world";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2670534;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"ShadinginRealWorld.mov";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T18:21:15Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:102;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:14;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260114;s:5:"title";s:27:"Shading a sphere and a cube";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:53:31Z";s:11:"description";s:271:"

In Pixel Art, everything is 2D. But how can we make objects look three-dimensional? We have to use shading. When we shade an object, we give it a sense of volume. there are a few rules to this. This lecture explains them by using primitive solids as an example.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"shading-a-sphere-and-a-cube";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531768;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"05.ShadingSphereCube.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T13:35:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:101;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:15;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260120;s:5:"title";s:33:"Shading a pyramid and a cylinder.";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:54:10Z";s:11:"description";s:228:"

After learning the most simple solids (Sphere and Cube) its time to have a go at another couple of simple volumes: A pyramid and a cylinder. These two new volumes follow the same rules, but have unique characteristics.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:32:"shading-a-pyramid-and-a-cylinder";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531740;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:29:"06.ShadingCylinderPyramid.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T13:29:50Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:100;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:16;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260124;s:5:"title";s:34:"Creating an apple sprite - Shading";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:54:33Z";s:11:"description";s:192:"

With the skill of shading, we now have the power to move into a three-dimensional object: An Apple. We discuss the apple's unique shape, and how it affects the shading.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:32:"creating-an-apple-sprite-shading";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531778;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"07.Apple1.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T13:36:49Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:99;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:17;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260128;s:5:"title";s:35:"Creating an apple sprite - Outlines";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:54:42Z";s:11:"description";s:145:"

Outlines are one of the best ways to make objects stand out from the background. In this lecture we give a try to 3 types or outlining.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:33:"creating-an-apple-sprite-outlines";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531754;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"08.Apple2.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T13:31:54Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:98;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:18;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260132;s:5:"title";s:34:"Creating an apple sprite - Texture";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:54:58Z";s:11:"description";s:235:"

While still using the colors from the shading, we can add a layer of texture buy changing how we shade the volume. If instead of smooth shapes we take the care to add some variation to our transitions, we can suggest texture.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:32:"creating-an-apple-sprite-texture";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531798;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"09.Apple3.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T13:42:04Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:97;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:19;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260136;s:5:"title";s:40:"Creating an apple sprite - Bounced Light";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:55:12Z";s:11:"description";s:265:"

Shading gives and object volume, and an outline makes it stand out. But how do we make and object seem to belong in a scene? We need to light it with additional light. In this lecture I should the use of bounced light, so help place an object on the scene

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:38:"creating-an-apple-sprite-bounced-light";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531804;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"10.Apple4.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T13:43:43Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:96;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:20;a:14:{s:6:"_class";s:4:"quiz";s:2:"id";i:115700;s:5:"title";s:7:"Shading";s:4:"type";s:11:"simple-quiz";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-20T16:16:47Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"sort_order";i:95;s:12:"object_index";i:2;s:8:"is_draft";b:0;s:7:"version";i:1;s:8:"duration";N;s:12:"pass_percent";N;}i:21;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260148;s:5:"title";s:57:"Revisiting the Sword sprite - Adding shading and outlines";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T11:57:16Z";s:11:"description";s:182:"

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:23:"color-in-shading-part-2";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10517834;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:28:"6.ShadingWithColor_part2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-12-06T15:22:41Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:84;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:32;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8735830;s:5:"title";s:28:"Colors in materials - Part 1";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-12-06T15:08:25Z";s:11:"description";s:144:"

Materials not only have difference in shading, but also in the way they show color. In this lecture we will look at some classic examples

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:26:"colors-in-materials-part-1";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10517850;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"7.Materials_Part1.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-12-06T15:25:12Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:83;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:33;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:8735834;s:5:"title";s:28:"Colors in materials - Part 2";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-12-06T15:08:34Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:26:"colors-in-materials-part-2";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10517902;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"8.Materials_Part2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-12-06T15:31:34Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:82;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:34;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:596504;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T13:44:53Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:80;s:5:"title";s:18:"Working with tiles";s:11:"description";s:87:"In order to create a practical mockup of a game, you should know how to work with tiles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:35;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2260668;s:5:"title";s:26:"The basic concept of tiles";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T13:45:00Z";s:11:"description";s:220:"

Tiles are by far the most used technique for filling the screen with a world. From Platformers to RPGs, tiles have always been widely used . This lecture serves as an introduction to the concept behind tiles.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:26:"the-basic-concept-of-tiles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2531834;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:26:"12.IntroductionToTiles.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T13:53:35Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:79;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:36;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2261702;s:5:"title";s:22:"Creating the base tile";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T16:08:53Z";s:11:"description";s:227:"

With the concept sinking in, we can now go and make out base tile. This will be our main orientation, as it will provide size, style, color palette, volume and camera perspective.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:22:"creating-the-base-tile";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570290;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:26:"13.CreatingTheBaseTile.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:08:57Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:78;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:37;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2261710;s:5:"title";s:49:"Creating a simple background and adjusting colors";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T16:09:40Z";s:11:"description";s:258:"

With a bunch of things established, we can move a little more forward with the mockup, by adding a background. In this lecture I show a really quick and simple way to create a background scene that will serve as a backdrop for the mockup.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:49:"creating-a-simple-background-and-adjusting-colors";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2532700;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:26:"14.BackgroundAndColors.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-19T16:19:01Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:77;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:38;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2385788;s:5:"title";s:20:"Conclusion Section 4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:29:18Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"conclusion-section-4";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2670976;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"section4.mov";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:35:12Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:76;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:39;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:605932;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:44:07Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:75;s:5:"title";s:25:"Improving the environment";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:40;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297082;s:5:"title";s:29:"Aditional Tiles for variation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T21:49:50Z";s:11:"description";s:233:"

The game world will be made with all these tiles, so it would be nice to have some variation. Taking some of the lessons learned in previous lectures we add variation and depth to out mockup by adding variation in the tiles

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:29:"aditional-tiles-for-variation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570484;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"15.VariationTiles.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:14:21Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:74;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:41;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297086;s:5:"title";s:16:"Decorative tiles";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T21:50:34Z";s:11:"description";s:203:"

Extra tiles will help solidify the game world, and make i more believable. This lecture shows how you can do it, and what problems you'll face, and, obviously, how to solve them!

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:16:"decorative-tiles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570314;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"16.DecorativeTiles.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:12:52Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:73;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:42;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297210;s:5:"title";s:20:"Creating a pine tree";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:43:51Z";s:11:"description";s:132:"

Since the world right now is only made up with terrain, its time to add some additional elements for decoration and scale.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"creating-a-pine-tree";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570678;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:15:"17.PineTree.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:56:59Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:72;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:43;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297214;s:5:"title";s:24:"Reworking the background";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:43:56Z";s:11:"description";s:114:"

Its time to turn our attention to the background, and make sure that it also follows the rules of tiles.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"reworking-the-background";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570684;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"18.FixingBackground.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T22:57:40Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:71;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:44;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3161622;s:5:"title";s:25:"Exercise - Building walls";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T18:03:33Z";s:11:"description";s:120:"

Imagine your side scrolling game is set in a metropolis. see how little tiles you need to make a big building.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:23:"exercise-building-walls";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3602140;s:10:"asset_type";s:6:"E-Book";s:5:"title";s:17:"tilesExercise.pdf";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T18:04:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:70;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:45;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2385790;s:5:"title";s:20:"Conclusion Section 5";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:29:27Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"conclusion-section-5";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2671122;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"section5.mov";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:56:30Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:69;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:46;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:605970;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:08:21Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:68;s:5:"title";s:20:"Creating a character";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:47;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297328;s:5:"title";s:17:"Creating the head";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:08:33Z";s:11:"description";s:239:"

With out mockup now ready, we can start working on our character. There are a lot of considerations to take into account. We start by just creating the head, and with that we define the size, color, age, and sex of our character.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:17:"creating-the-head";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570744;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"19.CreatingtheHEad.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:24:16Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:67;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:48;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297330;s:5:"title";s:17:"Creating the body";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:08:38Z";s:11:"description";s:175:"

While the head provides with the identity of the character, the body provides with an attitude. Pose and shape will help convey a personality for out game character.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:17:"creating-the-body";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570740;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"20.CreatingtheBody.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:21:43Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:66;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:49;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297332;s:5:"title";s:18:"Detailing the body";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:09:02Z";s:11:"description";s:202:"

Once we are happy with a body shape, we need to make it as interesting, easy to read and as recognizable as possible. For this we use shading techniques to help give a sense of depth and scale

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:18:"detailing-the-body";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570734;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"21.DetailingtheBody.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:19:17Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:65;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:50;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2297378;s:5:"title";s:17:"Adding an outline";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:26:36Z";s:11:"description";s:248:"

Just like we did with the apple and sword, we will also now use the same outlinning technique to help our character stand out. But while doing this, we must understand that it will have consequences in out workflow in the future.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:17:"adding-an-outline";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2570764;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"22.AddingAnOutline.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-01-25T23:30:02Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:64;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:51;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2386076;s:5:"title";s:20:"Conclusion Section 6";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:48:55Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:20:"conclusion-section-6";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2671112;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"section6.mov";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-09T19:56:06Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:63;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:52;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:616778;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:12:37Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:62;s:5:"title";s:9:"Animation";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:53;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2353316;s:5:"title";s:33:"The tools and basics of animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T08:26:51Z";s:11:"description";s:0:"";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:33:"the-tools-and-basics-of-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2634016;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:28:"22-5.Basics of animation.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T08:36:03Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:61;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:54;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2341828;s:5:"title";s:31:"Creating the base for animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:12:47Z";s:11:"description";s:225:"

Now is the time to take our character from a mockup into a living thing. We do this with animation. Its no the most simple thing, but it is a key aspect of suggesting that the character is alive and ready for action

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:31:"creating-the-base-for-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2620654;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:32:"23.CreatingIdleAnimationBase.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:24:35Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:60;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:55;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2341830;s:5:"title";s:58:"Breathing life into the character with secondary animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:13:05Z";s:11:"description";s:266:"

Simple as it may be, we need to add more detail to out animation, for it to read well, and look more alive. In this lecture we go into the issue of secondary animation and how we can make something look more organic rather than stiff and robotic.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:58:"breathing-life-into-the-character-with-secondary-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2620640;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:36:"24.BreathingLifeIntoTheCharacter.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-02T14:23:15Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:59;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:56;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2346784;s:5:"title";s:21:"Animating a run cycle";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-03T12:26:11Z";s:11:"description";s:216:"

Running animation is one of the most important to learn and master. They convey weight, speed and agilty. But before you can do one on the go, we first should learn how to plot and plan a running animation.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:21:"animating-a-run-cycle";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2626938;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"25.RunningAnimation.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-03T12:33:21Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:58;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:57;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2347006;s:5:"title";s:24:"Completing the run cycle";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-03T13:37:37Z";s:11:"description";s:157:"

With out animation planned out all we need now is to go in an fill the gaps. It takes time, but is so much faster once we have everything in place.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"completing-the-run-cycle";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2627220;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:27:"26.RunAnimationComplete.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-03T13:40:50Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:57;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:58;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2353298;s:5:"title";s:19:"Animating an attack";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T08:26:12Z";s:11:"description";s:265:"

Idle and running so far were animations with continuous frame rate. Each frame was on the screen the same time as the others. In this attack animation we see how we can make a frame be faster or stay longer on the screen, to change the animation dynamics.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:19:"animating-an-attack";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2634004;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"27.AttackAnimation.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-02-04T08:33:37Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:56;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:59;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3161588;s:5:"title";s:20:"Exercise - Character";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T17:58:56Z";s:11:"description";s:200:"

This exercise was designed to let you not only practice your character drawing skills, but also develop the capacity to interpret a concept design, and try and translate that into pixel art.

In this lecture you'll learn how to save one image with all your frames, and how you import that image into unity and configure it for use in a video game situation.

In this lecture we look into the animation panel in unity to rebuild our animations to work with unity.

Now that we have all our animations we can turn the player into a movable character with a couple of free scripts and some layer fiddling around. Find the attached resources to get the scripts and character sprite or follow the instructions on the lecture.

Before creating terrain tiles, we need to understand what the "game camera" is meant to see and show to the player or user. So in this lecture we'll look at a 3d model and see how a topdown perspective is built.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"what-is-topdown-perspective";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818400;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:25:"31.TopDownPerspective.avi";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:45:58Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:47;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:67;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511206;s:5:"title";s:29:"Different types of techniques";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:35:56Z";s:11:"description";s:216:"

Even though its hard to find names to call these different techniques of creating and using terrain tiles, I've created a selection of the four I feel are the most important and most used in pixel art.

Creating tiles can be intimidating if you think about the amount of variations you have to make. So we start with the most straigh forward one: Path Tiles. We'll create a fundation for all the tile pieces we need.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:41:"creating-path-tiles-setting-up-the-pieces";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818402;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"33.PathTiles_Part1.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:46:31Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:45;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:69;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511210;s:5:"title";s:47:"Creating Path Tiles - Creating a usable pattern";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:36:56Z";s:11:"description";s:187:"

With the most basic pieces created, we now have enough material to create the next pieces with ease, by just reusing parts. We do this to create the base pattern for out tileset

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:45:"creating-path-tiles-creating-a-usable-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818410;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"34.PathTiles_Part2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:48:48Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:44;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:70;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511212;s:5:"title";s:49:"Creating Path Tiles - Adding Shading to the tiles";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:37:16Z";s:11:"description";s:192:"

The main pattern is done, the road is very evident on the screen, but we can still add a little depth. We'll do that by creating a sense of relief on the road and grass

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:47:"creating-path-tiles-adding-shading-to-the-tiles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:1;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818430;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:18:"35.PathShading.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:53:08Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:43;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:1;}i:71;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2511214;s:5:"title";s:42:"Creating Path Tiles - Trying out the tiles";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:37:37Z";s:11:"description";s:138:"

Now that it's complete, lets take it for a spin, and see how it behaves. We'll build road using the tiles we created.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:40:"creating-path-tiles-trying-out-the-tiles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2818426;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"36.TryingOuttheTiles.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T09:52:28Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:42;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:72;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2512674;s:5:"title";s:39:"Patch Tiles - Understanding the pattern";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T14:34:30Z";s:11:"description";s:205:"

In this lecture, we'll look at how complicated the patch tiles pattern can be. We'll see how its used, and find a solution for a much simpler pattern that will do the same job

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:37:"patch-tiles-understanding-the-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2846276;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"36.PatchTilesPattern.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-05T11:12:55Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:41;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:73;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2512632;s:5:"title";s:39:"PatchTiles - Creating a base grass tile";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T14:29:39Z";s:11:"description";s:134:"

Before we do our patch tile set we want to create some base tiles for use later on. We start by making a standard grass tile

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:37:"patchtiles-creating-a-base-grass-tile";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2846226;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:16:"37.GrassTile.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-05T10:59:04Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:40;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:74;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2512640;s:5:"title";s:38:"Patch Tiles - Improving the grass tile";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T14:30:02Z";s:11:"description";s:147:"

After we got a base grass tile laid down, we want to improve on its look so that it breaks the grid effect and looks like grass

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:36:"patch-tiles-improving-the-grass-tile";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2846228;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"38.GrassBasePart2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-05T10:59:42Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:39;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:75;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2512650;s:5:"title";s:36:"Patch Tiles - Creating the dirt tile";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-02T14:30:30Z";s:11:"description";s:130:"

To go with the grass tile, we'll create a dirt tile as well, that we'll later use to make all the transitions

With our base tiles created we can go ahead and start putting a pattern together so that we can build our tile set

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:32:"patch-tiles-creating-the-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2846278;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"40.MakingTheTiles.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-05T11:13:26Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:37;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:77;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2541580;s:5:"title";s:27:"BlockTiles - The cliff side";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:10:50Z";s:11:"description";s:240:"

Elevation is one of the main features of the block tile technique, so lets take advantage of that. Since we already have a grass texture and a dirt texture, all we need now is a cliff side texture to use as an elevation indicator.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:25:"blocktiles-the-cliff-side";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2856090;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"41.BlockTilesCliff.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:21:55Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:36;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:78;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2541594;s:5:"title";s:38:"Block Tiles - Creating the transitions";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:12:14Z";s:11:"description";s:181:"

With the cliff tile created, we need not to make transitions from the grass tile to the edges of the cliff side. One those are made we can more effectively suggest height.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:36:"block-tiles-creating-the-transitions";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2856100;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:28:"42.BlockTilesTransitions.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:26:35Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:35;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:79;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2541602;s:5:"title";s:29:"Block Tiles - adding a shadow";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:12:24Z";s:11:"description";s:179:"

To further increase the effect oh height the ideal is to add a shadow to the tile set. in this lecture we go about doing that and what tricks you can use to achieve that

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"block-tiles-adding-a-shadow";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2856096;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"43.BlockTilesShadow.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:25:11Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:34;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:80;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2541604;s:5:"title";s:36:"Block Tiles - Trying out the pattern";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:12:37Z";s:11:"description";s:105:"

With the small pattern complete, we can take the tileset for a spinn and see how it looks like.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"block-tiles-trying-out-the-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:2856106;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:23:"44.BlockTilesTrying.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-03-06T20:27:55Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:33;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:81;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3161582;s:5:"title";s:24:"Exercise - River Pattern";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T17:57:39Z";s:11:"description";s:128:"

With a grass tile and a cliff/dirt tile, it is fairly easy to create now a river pattern to add to the world.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:22:"exercise-river-pattern";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3602114;s:10:"asset_type";s:6:"E-Book";s:5:"title";s:20:"pathTileExercise.pdf";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-27T17:57:57Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:32;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:82;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:1421092;s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:48:57Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:31;s:5:"title";s:23:"Top-Down RPG Characters";s:11:"description";s:119:"The goal of this section is to show effective methods in creating characters for rpg type games in top-down perspective";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:83;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676614;s:5:"title";s:12:"Introduction";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:05Z";s:11:"description";s:41:"

Short introduction to the section.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:12:"introduction";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6731306;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:9:"Intro.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-05T18:17:59Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:30;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:84;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676616;s:5:"title";s:21:"Design considerations";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:15Z";s:11:"description";s:184:"

In this first lecture we have a look at the considerations to have when designing a character for a top down perspective, especially if its going to be viewed in a small area.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:21:"design-considerations";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725158;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"01.ConceptToPixel.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:59:46Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:29;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:85;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676618;s:5:"title";s:19:"Basic Shapes Method";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:24Z";s:11:"description";s:262:"

In this size of characters, the line art process can clutter the sprite. So most of the time, its better to avoid tracing over a complex drawing and instead define solid shapes.
Solid shapes provide a quick understanding of the model and its parts.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:19:"basic-shapes-method";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725194;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:18:"02.BasicShapes.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:06:48Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:28;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:86;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676620;s:5:"title";s:18:"Shading Principles";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:31Z";s:11:"description";s:198:"

This lecture focuses on explaining the shading method and the facial features.
Before we move on to shading the body, we get a notion of the reasons behind the type of shading methods.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:18:"shading-principles";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725204;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"03.ShadingPrinciples.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:08:30Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:27;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:87;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676624;s:5:"title";s:16:"Shading the body";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:41Z";s:11:"description";s:183:"

In this lecture we go ahead and create more colors to shade the body completely. We use techniques such as cast shadows and outlining to give form to what was only flat shapes.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:16:"shading-the-body";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725248;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"04.ShadingTheBody.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:21:30Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:26;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:88;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676626;s:5:"title";s:34:"Creating and shading the side view";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:49:47Z";s:11:"description";s:86:"

From the front view we create the side view and shade it using the same colors.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"creating-and-shading-the-side-view";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725622;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:18:"05.ShadingSide.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T22:22:49Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:25;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:89;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676628;s:5:"title";s:34:"Creating and shading the back view";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:50:05Z";s:11:"description";s:149:"

Creating the back view for the character is a matter of editing the front view and make sure the elements of the body are kept in perspective.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:34:"creating-and-shading-the-back-view";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725298;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:21:"06.ShadingTheBack.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:32:33Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:24;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:90;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676630;s:5:"title";s:25:"Front view walk animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:50:14Z";s:11:"description";s:150:"

A simple 4 frame walk animation can be made just from moving the legs, but we add more detail to the whole body to really improve the animation

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:25:"front-view-walk-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725318;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:24:"07.AnimateAFrontWalk.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:35:39Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:23;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:91;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676632;s:5:"title";s:24:"Side View walk animation";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:50:19Z";s:11:"description";s:152:"

The side view is the easiest to animate, as the feet are very visible to the game camera. Still, we must worry about the perspective they are in.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"side-view-walk-animation";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725454;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"08.AnimateSideWalk.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T21:04:32Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:22;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:92;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:5676636;s:5:"title";s:33:"Complete animations demonstration";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T19:50:47Z";s:11:"description";s:135:"

After adding back a few details here and there, this lecture serves as a demonstration of what can be done with a few additions.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:33:"complete-animations-demonstration";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6725434;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:22:"09.FinalAnimations.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-09-04T20:59:42Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:21;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:93;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:770930;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-18T08:27:53Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:20;s:5:"title";s:13:"Student Edits";s:11:"description";s:150:"This section will host video lectures of me doing edits on some of the work that student's post. The purpose is to show how you can improve your work.";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:94;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2944312;s:5:"title";s:29:"Alan Pauley - Chalice shading";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-18T08:28:46Z";s:11:"description";s:117:"

In this lecture, I take Alan's work and paint over it to explain my suggestions.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"alan-pauley-chalice-shading";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3343776;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"AlanEdit.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-18T08:35:10Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:19;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:95;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:2989704;s:5:"title";s:31:"Jason Brennan - Fish and candle";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-26T21:23:29Z";s:11:"description";s:233:"

This lecture is an edit to the original artwork of Jason Brennan. He chose some very hard subjects to do in pixel art so the lecture is more about fixing what's done rather than showing a different aproach

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:29:"jason-brennan-fish-and-candle";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3399140;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:13:"JasonEdit.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-05-26T21:27:52Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:18;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:96;a:7:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"chapter";s:2:"id";i:793732;s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:13:41Z";s:10:"sort_order";i:17;s:5:"title";s:19:"Isometric pixel art";s:11:"description";s:89:"This section focus on creating pixel art while in the constrains of isometric perspective";s:12:"is_published";b:1;}i:97;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3035532;s:5:"title";s:35:"Understanding isometric perspective";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:14:03Z";s:11:"description";s:229:"

Isometric perspective is based on keeping the same dimensions in all 3 axis. This has its advantages and disadvantages. In this lecture we look at some of the specifications when drawing images in isometric perspective.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:35:"understanding-isometric-perspective";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3453962;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"lecture1.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:27:30Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:16;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:98;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3035538;s:5:"title";s:26:"Creating an isometric grid";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:14:24Z";s:11:"description";s:382:"

If you are going to create an isometric world, you need to get yourself an isometric grid. This will help you line everything up, making sure parts fit into each other and that you always have a good reference of where your lines should be. On the resources you'll find the base for the isometric tile, if you don't want to create a base tile yourself.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:26:"creating-an-isometric-grid";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3453954;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"lecture2.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:26:59Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:15;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:99;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3035552;s:5:"title";s:44:"Construction lines for an isometric building";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:16:47Z";s:11:"description";s:221:"

In this lecture we start our isometric project: A tower with barracs. We first define the scale, position and shape of our building and place down some construction lines for what we will be creating afterwards.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:44:"construction-lines-for-an-isometric-building";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3453964;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:12:"Lecture3.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-06-03T22:27:43Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:14;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}}}

item.title: Complete Blender Creator: Learn 3D Modelling for Beginners
item.dc:creator: admin

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:21:"welcome-to-the-course";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9928716;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:34:"1_IS_CBC Welcome To The Course.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-16T16:42:48Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:317;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:3;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:4811582;s:5:"title";s:19:"What's Coming up...";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-03-24T11:08:41Z";s:11:"description";s:880:"

Michael goes through what you are to expect in the upcoming section and how the course is structured.

Course Structure

  • This first section is designed for complete beginners.
  • If you already have experience you might still find some of this beginning content useful.
  • You can speed up and slow down videos

Learning Journey

  • Aim to give you a breath of knowledge
  • Every lesson will focus on one key area of Blender.
  • Lessons will build on one another.
  • Skipping lectures isnt recommended.

More Than One Way

  • Multiple paths to the same outcome.
  • Not a right way.
  • My way isnt necessarily the quickest.
  • If you have another route, share with everyone your experience!



";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:15:"whats-coming-up";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6355110;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:35:"I&S 01.5 Whats Coming Up... .mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-07-07T12:14:19Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:316;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:4;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:4811546;s:5:"title";s:22:"How To Install Blender";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-03-24T11:05:06Z";s:11:"description";s:147:"
  • Where to download Blender from.
  • Installing Blender.
  • Check which version you have
  • Version 2.77 or Later
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:22:"how-to-install-blender";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";s:0:"";s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:5588930;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:27:"IS02HowToInstallBlender.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-03-22T19:44:04Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:315;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:5;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:4811548;s:5:"title";s:21:"Where to Find Support";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-03-24T11:05:15Z";s:11:"description";s:967:"

Help Others to Help You

  • We have a supportive community.
  • Start the conversation.
  • As you become more experienced help others too.
  • Finally I am always around to help, but it may take some time.

Ask Good Questions

  • Be specific about your Issue.
  • Tell us what you have tried so far.
  • Remember you can edit the discussion to add further things you have tried.
  • Include a picture of the issue.
  • [Question] Prefix to Discussion Title.

Have An Answer?

  • If you have solved your issue, let us know.
  • Tell us how you overcame the challenge.
  • [Solved] Prefix to Discussion Title.

Example:

  • If you have solved your issue, let us know.
  • Tell us how you overcame the challenge.
  • [Solved] Prefix to Discussion Title.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:0:"";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"sort_order";i:311;s:12:"object_index";i:1;s:8:"is_draft";b:0;s:7:"version";i:1;s:8:"duration";N;s:12:"pass_percent";N;}i:9;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:4814102;s:5:"title";s:18:"Control Interfaces";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-03-24T18:26:40Z";s:11:"description";s:670:"

Keyboards

  • F-Keys on a Mac - Fn Key required.
  • Other laptops also require the Fn Key.
  • On Linux Alt is a system Key, hold the windows key down at the same time
  • No NumberPad.

Mice

  • Using Blender without a 3 button mouse: Using a trackpad or stylus
  • still highly recommend a 3 button mouse and full size keyboard wherever possible.
  • Later on a stylus for artwork.

Blender's Visuals

  • You can change the appearance of Blender.
  • Personalise the interface.
  • Make it easier for you to see.

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:22:"section-3-introduction";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9941026;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:33:"1_BP_CBC Welcome to Section 3.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-10-17T18:14:33Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:273;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:47;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3231990;s:5:"title";s:24:"Lean Production Pipeline";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-07-09T13:39:33Z";s:11:"description";s:1260:"
  • Introducing lean production / rapid prototyping.
  • NOT pre-production, production, post-production.
  • Imagine these assets are for a bowling game.
  • Knowing how fast / how many iterations to do.
  • Knowing when to stop iterating!
A Definition of Lean Production
  • Eliminates waste created through overburden and unevenness in work loads.
  • Maximises flow of value (anything that a customer would be willing to pay for).
  • Maximises quality by discovering the 20% of gold.
  • https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lean_manufacturing
The Pottery Fable
  • Teacher challenges class.
  • One half on quality, other on quantity.
  • At the end of the term, which wins?
  • Both from the quantity side.
  • Moral quality follows quantity.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"lean-production-pipeline";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:1;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3680220;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:33:"BP05 Lean Production Pipeline.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-07-09T14:07:09Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:272;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:48;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3188790;s:5:"title";s:36:"Knowing Your Topic and Specification";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-07-02T17:28:02Z";s:11:"description";s:180:"
  • Understanding your subject.
  • Planning your model.
  • Know the importance of research.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:36:"knowing-your-topic-and-specification";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3631088;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:44:"BP05 Knowing Yor Topic and Specification.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-07-02T17:30:13Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:271;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:49;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3276570;s:5:"title";s:19:"Blender Model Scale";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-07-16T14:28:37Z";s:11:"description";s:652:"
  • Has its own units called Blender Units (BU)
  • You can define a Blender unit as several units.
  • Works well between 0.01 - 100 BU
  • Rule of thumb: Use the Grid Floor as a stage.

  • Order of magnitude suitable for the Level of Detail

  • Updated 27/09/2017

Scale, Level of Detail and Models

  • One model doesn't have to contain it all!
  • Use multiple models if necessary.
  • Imagine zooming in from space to a bacteria.
  • You would make multiple models for each level of detail.

(Unique Video Reference: 07_BP_CBC)

  • When making a scene with multiple models.
  • You have control over the model, scale, position etc.
  • Can edit the model, like taking a copy into the current Blender file.
  • e.g. Coffee table plus two cups
Linked
  • When making an object of components.
  • You have no control over the models position, scale etc.
  • You still cannot edit the model, done at source.
  • e.g. An anotomical model

Duplicating Vs Appending

  • Appending picks out key parts of a blend file.
  • Other Scene data would have to be appended separately.
  • Duplicating would be exactly the same as the original file with everything intact.

  • Introducing the concept of an empty.
  • An empty is a null object, and has no geometry.
  • They can be used as a handle to control objects.
  • Used as a parent object for a group of objects.
  • Many other uses.
Keeping It Lean
  • Append the bishop into our chess scene.
  • Check everything is right proportion wise.
  • Start filling up our board, creating the white pawns.
  • Link duplicate our bishop and pawns.
  • Managing our models in this scene.

  • View Dolly: Ctrl + Shift + Middle-Mouse / Ctrl+ Shift + +/-.
  • Walk/Fly Mode: Shift + F.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:37:"zoom-to-mouse-rotate-around-selection";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4694446;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:48:"CS19 Zoom To Mouse & Rotate Around Selection.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-11-23T17:26:31Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:233;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:86;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3438934;s:5:"title";s:26:"Lighting in Blender Render";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-08-13T18:58:07Z";s:11:"description";s:483:"
  • Understand that lamps apply to Blender Render.
  • Light is handled differently in Cycles.
  • Adjusting lamps properties and seeing it's affect.
  • We will switch to rendered mode in the viewport shading options to see this effect.

Further Reading on Blender Render Lighting: + http://wiki.blender.org/index.php/Doc:2.4/Manual/Lighting/Lights/Light_Attenuation (Updated 28/3/2018)

(Unique Video Reference: 20_CS_CBC)

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:26:"lighting-in-blender-render";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:12542072;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:40:"20_CS_CBC Lighting In Blender Render.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2018-05-16T13:10:27Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:232;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:87;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3470512;s:5:"title";s:25:"Hiding Un-Needed Objects.";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-08-19T20:03:15Z";s:11:"description";s:236:"
  • Discover it is useful when working on larger and more complex assemblies or scenes.
  • Control whether you are hiding groups of objects as well as individuals.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"hiding-un-needed-objects";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3960168;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:34:"CS21 Hiding Un-Needed Objects..mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-08-19T20:25:24Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:231;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:88;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3477298;s:5:"title";s:36:"Diffuse and Specular: Blender Render";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-08-20T23:36:57Z";s:11:"description";s:486:"
  • Need to understand these for getting rendering right.
  • Looking at the two in isolation.
  • Combining them to see the effect.
  • Still using Blender Render.

Diffuse vs Specular Reflections

  • Both are types of reflection.
  • Diffuse is when Light scatters as it hits a surface.
  • Specular is direct reflection of the light to the viewer.
  • Materials are often a mix of the two.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:35:"diffuse-and-specular-blender-render";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4682518;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:38:"CS22 Defuse and Specular Materials.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-11-21T16:22:21Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:230;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:89;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3477804;s:5:"title";s:27:"Using An Image As A Texture";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-08-21T00:54:23Z";s:11:"description";s:275:"
  • Show you how to add a texture to your material.
  • Reinforce the defuse and specular settings.
  • Model the board surround.
  • Apply a texture to the board surround.
  • (Updated 26/09/2017)

(Unique Video Reference: 23_CS_CBC)

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:27:"using-an-image-as-a-texture";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:9721572;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:41:"23_CS_CBC Using An Image As A Texture.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-09-27T10:07:34Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:229;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:90;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3477888;s:5:"title";s:25:"Using Procedural Textures";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-08-21T01:17:51Z";s:11:"description";s:151:"
  • Introduce procedural textures.
  • Apply some to the chequers on the board.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:25:"using-procedural-textures";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:3969382;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:34:"CS24 Using Procedural Textures.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-08-21T01:33:28Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:228;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:91;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3551044;s:5:"title";s:28:"Quads Vs Triangles and Ngons";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-01T17:06:51Z";s:11:"description";s:297:"
  • Better overall to make models using quads.
  • Explain what they are.
  • Whatever you use- it is being converted back to triangles in the background.
  • Watch out making things non planer
  • (Updated 1/1/2018)

(Unique Video Reference: 25_CS_CBC)

";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:28:"quads-vs-triangles-and-ngons";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:10919014;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:42:"25_CS_CBC Quads Vs Triangles and Ngons.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2018-01-12T10:46:15Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:227;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:92;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3556548;s:5:"title";s:19:"Non Planar Geometry";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-02T13:38:36Z";s:11:"description";s:955:"
  • Only happens with quads and NGons.
  • Rendering & Exporting always converts geometry into triangles.- Lose control over the rendering.
  • You cannot always see this in the 3D window.
  • Makes a huge difference with flat models and flat shading.

Triangles and NGons

  • If your model comes to a point you might need a triangle.
  • When sub dividing part of you model you are likely to create an NGon elsewhere.
  • You will break loops when doing this.

Solutions

  • Good mesh topology from the beginning.
  • Be lean and check your model through.
  • Turn on mesh analysis (not 100%).
  • Manually make face(s) Planar again. Normal, SZZ0.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:19:"non-planar-geometry";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:6397050;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:28:"CS26 Non Planer Geometry.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2016-07-13T21:34:25Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:226;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:93;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3557886;s:5:"title";s:10:"Edge Rings";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-02T17:51:22Z";s:11:"description";s:221:"
  • Learn about edge rings.
  • How they help you manage your geometry.
  • Definition: A series of edges which are not directly connected, but share faces.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:10:"edge-rings";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4693012;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:25:"CS27 Edge Ring Select.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-11-23T13:41:00Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:225;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:94;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3559468;s:5:"title";s:19:"The Mirror Modifier";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-02T21:59:49Z";s:11:"description";s:148:"
  • How to setup and use the Mirror modifier.
  • Start creating our Knight.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:19:"the-mirror-modifier";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4726650;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:28:"CS28 The Mirror Modifier.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-11-27T23:06:46Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:224;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:95;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3559894;s:5:"title";s:23:"The Edge Split Modifier";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-03T00:10:09Z";s:11:"description";s:308:"
  • Focus on creating a free form model.
  • Ensuring faces are not triangulated when being created to keep with our style.
  • Introduce the edge split modifier.
  • This is the basis of organic modelling.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:23:"the-edge-split-modifier";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:8063158;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:37:"29_CS_CBC The Edge Split Modifier.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2017-03-27T10:09:32Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:223;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:96;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3561766;s:5:"title";s:26:"Modelling Challenge - Rook";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-03T11:21:33Z";s:11:"description";s:220:"
  • Start the Rook from the LP Chess Piece Base we made earlier.
  • Remember to use the reference material for a rough scale and shape guide.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"modelling-challenge-rook";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4067894;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:35:"CS30 Modelling Challenge - Rook.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-03T12:07:26Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:222;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:97;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3561872;s:5:"title";s:26:"Modelling Challenge - King";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-03T11:51:17Z";s:11:"description";s:269:"
  • Suggest using the queen as a starting point.
  • To make the King the right size by out specs, a base of 4 > 4.5 is a scale of 1.125.
  • Make the king your own, and have fun.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:24:"modelling-challenge-king";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4067916;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:35:"CS31 Modelling Challenge - King.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-03T12:12:48Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:221;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:98;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3562234;s:5:"title";s:33:"Setting Up A Camera For Rendering";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-03T12:48:20Z";s:11:"description";s:278:"
  • Learn about camera placement.
  • They're a directional object.
  • Overview of the camera settings.
  • You can have more than one camera, but only one active camera.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:33:"setting-up-a-camera-for-rendering";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4069424;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:42:"CS32 Setting Up A Camera For Rendering.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-03T16:42:55Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:220;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}i:99;a:13:{s:6:"_class";s:7:"lecture";s:2:"id";i:3595686;s:5:"title";s:26:"Exporting Your Chess Model";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-09T14:08:48Z";s:11:"description";s:327:"
  • Tidy our folders for future access.
  • Export your model(s) as an FBX.
  • Import .FBX into Unreal and Unity game engines.
  • Opening Blender models in Unity 5.
  • About exporting textures and materials.
";s:13:"title_cleaned";s:26:"exporting-your-chess-model";s:12:"is_published";b:1;s:10:"transcript";N;s:15:"is_downloadable";b:0;s:7:"is_free";b:0;s:5:"asset";a:5:{s:6:"_class";s:5:"asset";s:2:"id";i:4106012;s:10:"asset_type";s:5:"Video";s:5:"title";s:29:"CS33 Exporting Your Model.mp4";s:7:"created";s:20:"2015-09-09T14:45:31Z";}s:10:"sort_order";i:219;s:16:"can_be_previewed";b:0;}}}

item.title: After Effects CC 2019: Complete Course from Novice to Expert
item.dc:creator: admin

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Create stunning Motion Graphics, VFX Visual Effects & VFX Compositing with hands-on tutorials & 50+ practice projects.

a:4:{i:0;s:79:"No Prior Knowledge of After Effects, Visual Effects or Motion Graphics Required";i:1;s:51:"A working copy of After Effects CC 2019 or CC 2018";i:2;s:68:"All project files are available in After Effects CC 2019 and CC 2018";i:3;s:68:"Backward compatibility up to After Effects CC 2013 for all projects";}

a:11:{i:0;s:69:"How to use all of After Effects CC - in a dynamic, hands on approach.";i:1;s:54:"Work with the latest 2019 Responsive Design Techniques";i:2;s:87:"Create Motion Graphics to enhance your videos using a step by step, easy-to-use method.";i:3;s:96:"Boost your creativity by completing 50+ Practice Activities and projects from simple to complex.";i:4;s:66:"Practice compositing techniques to achieve stunning video effects.";i:5;s:57:"Master Visual Time Effects on Videos and Motion Graphics.";i:6;s:132:"How to use specialized visual effects such Motion Tracking, Camera Tracking, Chromakeying, Rotoscoping, Stabilizing and many more";i:7;s:112:"Work in 3D space with Cameras, Lights and Shadows and practice your new skills with 3D Motion Graphics Projects.";i:8;s:54:"How to Import and animate Illustrator Vector Graphics.";i:9;s:79:"Create advanced Type Animation in 2D & 3D cool stuff only in After Effects.";i:10;s:92:"And much more for you to become an expert in Motion Graphics, Visual Effects and Compositing";}

[{"answer":"You can view and review the lecture materials indefinitely, like an on-demand channel.","question":"How long do I have access to the course materials?"},{"answer":"Definitely! If you have an internet connection, courses on Udemy are available on any device at any time. If you don't have an internet connection, some instructors also let their students download course lectures. That's up to the instructor though, so make sure you get on their good side!","question":"Can I take my courses with me wherever I go?"}]
